For service from these stations, take the [B]* or [Q] to Kings Hwy or Newkirk Plaza and transfer to a

Note: Coney Island-bound platforms at Parkside Av, Beverley and Cortelyou Rds are closed for renovation.

line.name: Ronkonkoma
line.text:
Planned Work

Buses Replace Two Midday Weekday Trains between Riverhead & Greenport thru May 16

Â

Weekdays through Friday, May 16, buses replace two midday trains between Riverhead and Greenport as trackwork is performed.Â The affected trains are:

Â

Eastbound:

Â

The 11:27AM train from Riverhead, scheduled to depart Mattituck at 11:43AM, Southold at 11:57AM, and Greenport at 12:07PM, is canceled for scheduled track work. Customers will be accommodated at 11:37AM by bus from Riverhead, scheduled to arrive in Mattituck at 11:53AM, Southold at 12:07 PM and Greenport at 12:17 PM

Â

Westbound:

Â

The 12:42PM train from Greenport, scheduled to depart Southold at 12:52PM, Mattituck at 1:05PM, and Riverhead at 1:21PM, is canceled for scheduled track work. Customers will be accommodated at 12:31PM by bus from Greenport, arriving at Southold at 12:41PM, Mattituck at 12:55PM and Riverhead at 1:11PM.

Â

Pick up the February 24 Ronkonkoma Branch timetable or see http://bit.ly/17ItWIh.

line.name: New Haven
line.text:
Service Change  Posted: 05/14/2014  6:02AM

Metro-North expects 5-10 minute delays on the New Haven Line until further notice due to a fire that destroyed a critical switching control house near Cos Cob on Saturday, limiting the railroad to two of four tracks in the peak direction through a nine-mile area. The fire has also resulted in eliminating the ability of the railroad to operate trains around problems in this area. Crews are currently working around the clock to make repairs. See http://bit.ly/1nDxEqt for details. We regret any inconvenience you may experience as a result of this incident.



Service Change  Posted: 05/12/2014  3:41PM

Metro-North's Train Time App, website information, and station LCD monitors rely on the signal system to track the status of trains and provide train information. Due to the damage to the control house that affects the signal system between Stamford and Port Chester, there will be inaccurate reporting on the status of trains while going through this section of the New Haven Line. Once trains have cleared the section, their current status will be updated to provide real-time train information.

line.name: Danbury
line.text:
Service Change  Posted: 04/03/2014  6:13PM

A temporary Danbury schedule will be in effect starting Saturday, March 1, until further notice, to provide a more reliable service while contractors for Metro-North and the Connecticut Dept. of Transportation (ConnDOT) work to resolve the problem with the new grade crossing system. This problem has necessitated "Stop and Warn" procedures to ensure safe train movements past each crossing, resulting in delays. The schedule will include time adjustments for most weekday peak-period trains as well as substitute busing for weekday off-peak and weekend service. For more information, visit http://tinyurl.com/lf8tthl
